page.title: 18CLUBS IN CRUWYS MORCHARD
page.content: The Women's Institute, with 30 members, meets at the Parish Hall the 2nd Wednesday of each month except January. After the business meeting a guest speaks on subjects such as handcrafts, travel or social issues. The WI belongs to the Twyford Group, every four years hosting a Group Meeting at which a play written by a a member is performed. Darts and skittles matches take place against other institutes. The Young Farmers' Club, membership 20, meets on the 1st Wednesday of the month. They have demonstrations and talks and take part in quiz programmes and sports with other clubs in the Tiverton Group. The Ladies' Fellowship of Pennymoor Chapel have speakers for talks or slide-shows, a hymn or prayer follow. The team of bell-ringers are always prepared for special occasions.
